cyclone.name: ETA
cyclone.current_location: about 80 miles NNW of the western tip of Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: Forecast to drift north today, then move slowly northeast across the eastern Gulf of Mexico toward the Florida Gulf Coast late Wednesday–Thursday before turning inland over the southeastern United States
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Gulf Coast (near Tampa–Cedar Key area)

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Keys, South & Central Florida Gulf Coast, Florida Panhandle, and northern Gulf Coast
weather_observation.wind: Breezy northeasterly winds possible late week-end (generally below tropical-storm force)
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected along the South Carolina coast from Eta
weather_observation.rainfall: Intermittent showers possible over the weekend with 1–2 inches total
weather_observation.other_hazards: Elevated rip-current risk along southeast U.S. beaches as swells from Eta reach the Atlantic coast
